About This Game

For Max Payne, the tragedies that took his loved ones years ago are wounds that refuse to heal. No longer a cop, close to washed up and addicted to pain killers, Max takes a job in SÃ£o Paulo, Brazil, protecting the family of wealthy real estate mogul Rodrigo Branco, in an effort to finally escape his troubled past. But as events spiral out of his control, Max Payne finds himself alone on the streets of an unfamiliar city, desperately searching for the truth and fighting for a way out.

Combining cutting edge shooting mechanics with a dark and twisted story, Max Payne 3 is a seamless, highly detailed, cinematic experience from Rockstar Games.

FEATURES:
â¢ Developed by Rockstar Games for a seamless, highly detailed, cinematic experience
â¢ Advanced Bullet TimeÂ® and Shootdodgeâ¢ and Final Kill-cam mechanics for stylish shooting action
â¢ Cutting edge aiming, targeting and animation processes for precise, fluid gunplay
â¢ A dark, twisted story chronicling the return of Max Payne, one of the most iconic characters in videogames
â¢ Tight integration between Natural Motionâs Euphoria Character Behavior System and a brand new iteration of the Rockstar Advanced Game Engine (RAGE) for lifelike movement and a new level of environmental awareness
â¢ A wide range of weapons rendered in incredible detail: hammers cock back, shells eject from the chamber and each bullet is individually modeled from the split second itâs fired to the moment of impact
â¢ Advanced particle physics and destructible environments set the stage for dramatic and chaotic gun fights
â¢ New to the series, a compelling and addictive multiplayer experience to match the dark and relentless atmosphere of the single-player game
â¢ Retired Feature: Online Multiplayer for Max Payne 3 on Mac will no longer be available in-game as of 5/31/14.

Abracadavre
208 products in account
17 reviews
Recommended
93.2 hrs on record
Posted: June 6
I'm re-writing this review since the first one i wrote was not so useful. 06/06/2015

I played and still play this game (singleplayer only) from day one, my first impression was "it's ok" , but back than i didn't understand many things.

/The Story
I loved both Max Payne 1 and 2 , i must say that the atmosphere in this game is definitely not the same but that's not a bad thing!
The story is incredibly dark and mature, it just doesn't show it most of the time.
First you might think there are many useless cutscenes but trust me , there are many things you will understand after finishing the game at least once.
You have a lot of space to think and a lot of things to understand , the game does not shove everything in your face.
Don't get fooled with the casual start of the game.

/This game is violent
Psychopaths / Sociopaths typically have no regard for right and wrong, they don't care about any consequences. It's just an illness and some people are born with it.
But when someone in right mind commits an extremely brutal crime there is just no excuse...
If you're not just an eye candy violence loving individual come back to me after seeing the ""WHAT HAVE YOU BEEN DOING HERE?!"" cutscene.

Say whatever you want but this game is definitely more violent than "Hatred" and any other "wow look gore, we are cool! badass" game.

/The Soundtrack
I didn't think it was something special at the beginning but it grew on me.
Now this is one of my most favorite soundtracks by "Health"
Fits the story and the atmosphere.
MAX:_NJ

/Controls
Walking moving controls can be a little unresponsive due to the game using hundreds of animations together, animation quality is amazing.
You don't just "slide" in circles when you move your mouse while aiming / walk or do something not traditional.
Mouse controls are also perfect, the best Rockstar port till date.

/Difficulty
Funny thing... "Hardcore" difficulty is actually more difficult than "Old School", after playing old school multiple times i once did a run with only few deaths.
But in Hardcore AI is more accurate and you take more damage, you just don't have the "Last Stand" in Old School difficulty.
It's next to impossible to beat the game without any downs in "Hardcore".
Overall the difficulty is fair and fun if you know what you are doing.

/overall
An amazing third person shooter with great story and gun battles.
Finished it 5/6 times , still want to play more.

Ray Liotta's Psycho Face
371 products in account
38 reviews
Recommended
17.5 hrs on record
Posted: May 15
You know those classic action movies staring the legendary Hong Kong actor Chow Yun Fat where he clears a room of bad guys whilst diving through the air in slow motion and dual wielding pistols? The Killer, A Better Tomorrow, Hard Boiled? Yeah those.
Do you want to do that over and over again for 10-12 hours and feel like a badass? Sure you do.
Also, Max Payne is an alcoholic, he practically pours whiskey on his morning cornflakes whilst reading Charles Bukowski poetry yet he is as accurate as an Olympic sharpshooter so y'know.....alcoholism rocks.

Chow Yun Fat simulator 2012.

9/10.

RivaL[.]ReNeGaDe
850 products in account
22 reviews
Recommended
13.4 hrs on record
Posted: October 26
Pros:

+Strong story driven title
+Narrative gameplay and cutscenes
+Gory
+Great Graphics
+Music fits nicely
+Voice acting is done great and fits in perfectly for the mood heâs portraying
+Cover system and slow time function are great
+Combat is good
+Very dark in nature
+AI donât mess around


The Middle:

+/-Linear gameplay (this is up to the player whoâs playing the game) â I felt they did an excellent job with the concept. It kept the player sucked into the story and at times made me forget I was going from point A to point B, but to go achieve that goal that was needed during that chapter. Not once did I think to myself that this was linear.
+/- Can sound emotional and/or depressing at times, but then again, this is where knowing the knowledge about the last two titles are crucial (I thought it fit in perfectly, but attitude reflects everyone differently when playing a game)



Cons:

-Can be a slow start or even a confusing start if you havenât played the original 2 games (or didnât even read about their story via some online source)
-Controls can be wonky at times or at times donât feel fluid as it should be
-Multiplayer is dead


Summary:

You are placed in Brazil to protect some VIPs and the action takes off immediately. The story at first can start off rather slowly, but it does pick up rather quickly after the first two or so chapters. Max Payne is always narrating the story (as if you were reading a comic book or something similar), whether itâs telling himself to go this direction or a witty comment on why he took the painkillers. Some of the cutscenes do elaborate some portion of his past, but they donât explain everything on what happened in his past. The cutscenes are nicely done and also give a lot of information for the chapter and the buildup to the final plot that shows at the end of the game.

The graphics are done excellently. A lot of detail went into this game. There is gore (for those who are squeamish), but itâs done right to fit the nature for this game. The blood splatter seems consistent to the bullet wounds and/or explosions, but not overly used when compared to other shoot-them-up titles (i.e. 5 gallons of blood on the floor with only one dead body).

The music fits nicely with the game and it doesnât sound overwhelming or try take the focus away when listening to the cutscenes and/or when Max Payne beings a narrative discussion. The sounds are done right and the explosions/gunfire is not overwhelming when firing them off. Voice acting was done very nicely. It wasnât bland, but it was dark and emotional; all relating to his past experiences.

The combat system is done nicely with the game. Youâre in 3rd person view unless you pick up selected weapons that have a scope on them. The cover system is done appropriately depending where and how you stay in cover. If someone that has a height advantage above you, theyâll more likely hit you while youâre in cover, but the same can be done to them. The aiming is flawless. I had no issues aiming at their heads whether it was normal pace or slow-motion, though at times the controls do feel wonky. I would have moments where I would want to slow-motion in a direction and the controls would hesitate or be unresponsive. This would also be the case when trying to go into cover, but it would hesitate, Iâd click again and it would send me into cover and then right back out of cover.

The AI hit their marks a lot more than most shoot-them-up shooters. This is why the cover system and slow-motion function are key. This isnât a Battlefield or Call of Duty similarity. This game relies heavily on those two functions or the outcome will be your undoing. I really enjoyed this title and I havenât played the other two titles. I did some reading on the story prior of playing this title, so I had some clue on what to expect when it came to his emotions and the reason why he was doing the things he did.

The game is rich in story, yet dark in nature. I was never bored or felt the gameplay was linear in any way, shape, or form. I felt the game was more of a movie that you control the main protagonist. I thought they did an excellent job at this game. I didn't play multiplayer because I didn't find any matches, so I cannot give a review based on any multiplayer aspects. Other than that, I would definitely recommend this game.
